info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 20 at 2:36AM CDT until April 21 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma...Texas...
Red River near Gainesville affecting Love and Cooke Counties.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Red River near Gainesville.
* WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow morning.
* IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Low-lying fields... upstream in western Love County in Oklahoma... and Cooke County in Texas... may experience shallow overflows several hours before the crest reaches the Interstate Highway I-35 crossing north of Gainesville. Sandpit operations may be affected. Livestock and other property should be removed to places which are higher than nearby river banks to avoid being stranded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 9.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 25.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 22.4 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall to 13.7 feet Tuesday evening. - Action stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW MORNING
